TopicTitle: What is the difference between Physics Warp and Time Warp?

Articles.Content:
It's been a while since I've been here, so the new update is awesome and confusing at the same time. Awesomely confusing?

I've noticed that when in the atmosphere using a space plane, it shows 4 arrows for time warp and it goes yellow to red and only has 1x, 2x, 3x and 4x. Probably means Physics Warp, even though it still says Time Warp: #x.

Then when you use a spaceship (not plane), it says Time Warp and it's the normal 1x, 5x, etc.

Is there a true difference in how the game operates between Physics Warp and Time Warp?

Yes physical time warp is a warp which you can time in the atmoshpere while also doing physical stuff but it should give you a warning before u try to use it it may effect how your ship or plane is put together. the Game has not fixed this yet but i think they are in 0.18
I believe when youre in atmosphere you can only do 4x warp.

It doesnt' matter if you use a space plane or rocket, if you are in the atmosphere you will only have up to 4x warp. If you hold "Alt" and use the comma key, you can use physical warp anywhere. It is really useful for long burns.

Physics warp up to X4 allows you to still have full control over your craft, no matter if its a spaceplane or rocket. Time warp, puts your craft on rails, meaning you can't alter its course or anything.
